This site also serves as the public face of the Career Services Council (CSC) , the coordinating council for undergraduate career services at IUPUI. ## About Campus Career and Advising Services   ### Mission statement  The Office of Campus Career and Advising Services (CCAS) works collaboratively with IUPUI’s schools, colleges, and relevant campus councils to advance advising and career services initiatives and to promote the integration of academic and career planning.  To this end, CCAS:  [career.iupui.edu](http://career.iupui.edu)  [advising.iupui.edu](http://advising.iupui.edu)  In addition, the CCAS senior executive director provides strategic leadership and oversight for the advising and career education units within University College: Academic and Career Development , Center for Transfer and Adult Students, Life-Health Sciences Internship Program , and Office of Student Employment .  [Academic and Career Development](https://acd.iupui.edu/)  [Center for Transfer and Adult Students,](https://ctas.iupui.edu/)  [Life-Health Sciences Internship Program](https://lhsi.iupui.edu/)  [Office of Student Employment](https://employment.iupui.edu/)  Advisors and career services professionals facilitate some of the most meaningful conversations that occur on this campus. We truly enjoy working to help these committed educators to challenge and to support IUPUI students with academic and career planning that empowers students to find their passions, plan their paths, and graduate on time and ready for their next opportunities. Please contact us with any questions about this critically important work that lays the foundation for student success.  View the staff directory

Deepen the campus commitment to community engagement and economic development through enhanced career services that prioritizes experiential learning and employer relations.  Standardize the quality of and training for career services professionals across campus.  Grow career services as a profession. Campus Career and Advising Services is committed to protecting your privacy and developing technology that gives you the most powerful and safe online experience. This Statement of Privacy applies to the Campus Career and Advising Services Web site and governs data collection and usage. By using the Campus Career and Advising Services website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.   ## Collection of your personal information  Campus Career and Advising Services collects personally identifiable information, such as your e-mail address, name, home or work address or telephone number. Campus Career and Advising Services also collects anonymous demographic information, which is not unique to you, such as your ZIP code, age, gender, preferences, interests and favorites.  There is also information about your computer hardware and software that is automatically collected by Campus Career and Advising Services. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring Web site addresses. This information is used by Campus Career and Advising Services for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the Campus Career and Advising Services Web site.  Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through Campus Career and Advising Services public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others. Note: Campus Career and Advising Services does not read any of your private online communications.  Campus Career and Advising Services encourages you to review the privacy statements of Web sites you choose to link to from Campus Career and Advising Services so that you can understand how those Web sites collect, use and share your information. Campus Career and Advising Services is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on Web sites outside of the Campus Career and Advising Services and Campus Career and Advising Services family of Web sites.   ## Use of your personal information  Campus Career and Advising Services collects and uses your personal information to operate the Campus Career and Advising Services Web site and deliver the services you have requested. Campus Career and Advising Services also uses your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from Campus Career and Advising Services and its affiliates. Campus Career and Advising Services may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered.  Campus Career and Advising Services does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. Campus Career and Advising Services may, from time to time, contact you on behalf of external business partners about a particular offering that may be of interest to you. In those cases, your unique personally identifiable information (e-mail, name, address, telephone number) is not transferred to the third party. In addition, Campus Career and Advising Services may share data with trusted partners to help us perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to Campus Career and Advising Services, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information.  Campus Career and Advising Services does not use or disclose sensitive personal information, such as race, religion, or political affiliations, without your explicit consent.  Campus Career and Advising Services keeps track of the Web sites and pages our customers visit within Campus Career and Advising Services, in order to determine what Campus Career and Advising Services services are the most popular. This data is used to deliver customized content and advertising within Campus Career and Advising Services to customers whose behavior indicates that they are interested in a particular subject area.  Campus Career and Advising Services Web sites will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on Campus Career and Advising Services or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of Campus Career and Advising Services; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of Campus Career and Advising Services, or the public.   ## Use of cookies  The Campus Career and Advising Services Web site use "cookies" to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a Web page server. Cookies cannot be used to run programs or deliver viruses to your computer. Cookies are uniquely assigned to you, and can only be read by a web server in the domain that issued the cookie to you.  One of the primary purposes of cookies is to provide a convenience feature to save you time. The purpose of a cookie is to tell the Web server that you have returned to a specific page. For example, if you personalize Campus Career and Advising Services pages, or register with Campus Career and Advising Services site or services, a cookie helps Campus Career and Advising Services to recall your specific information on subsequent visits. This simplifies the process of recording your personal information, such as billing addresses, shipping addresses, and so on. When you return to the same Campus Career and Advising Services Web site, the information you previously provided can be retrieved, so you can easily use the Campus Career and Advising Services features that you customized.  You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. ## Advising assessment  The Campus Advising Council has adopted outcomes that represent the process and delivery of advising at IUPUI and the learning that results from high-quality advising. These outcomes represent the common standards for advising across IUPUI's campus. Every two years, Campus Career and Advising Services (CCAS) leads an assessment team in a campuswide administration of the Collegiate Advising-Related Learning Inventory (CARLI). CCAS produces reports and leads campuswide and school-specific discussions of the results and decisions that need to be made to improve the advising experience at IUPUI.
